ai.summary: Ludwell Butterfly Trail is a 6.6 km moderate hike in the UK countryside. The route offers gentle terrain with butterfly-friendly habitats, rewarding sightings in meadow edges and woodland clearings. Suitable for walkers with some experience, the trail can be completed in 2–3 hours depending on pace and butterfly viewing.
ai.terrain_summary: The terrain is varied, with a mix of well-maintained grassy paths, gravel tracks, and short stretches of uneven ground. Expect occasional gentle inclines, some muddy sections after wet weather, and exposed sections where sun exposure may occur.
ai.safety_notes: Wear sturdy walking boots, bring weather-appropriate clothing, and carry water. Stay on marked paths, watch for ticks in tall grass, and check forecast for wind and rain. Carry a map or GPS and tell someone your plan; be prepared to turn back if conditions deteriorate.
recommended_gear: Map or smartphone GPS with offline map
ai.best_seasons: Spring through early autumn (April–September) when butterfly activity is typically highest, with longer daylight hours and mild temperatures.

seo.title: Ludwell Butterfly Trail – 6.6 km Moderate Hike in the UK
